I welcome the condemnation of Egypt's first elected President Mursi.
We know that as a country that has experienced similar incidents in the past, the continuation of such interim periods is difficult and costly.
As a person who wishes to always be strong in brotherly Egypt, I hope that there is a way for political prisoners to be free before they are released.
Thus, Egypt will be able to focus on the real and positive agenda it needs by getting rid of this political burden.
Let's make life! #dessinemoiuncoeur @televie http://t.co/GciFKNBO8u
I would like to express my regret on sentencing of Mr. Mursi, first freely elected President of Egypt.
As a country which has experienced similar events in the past, we know that such interim periods are difficult to sustain and very costly.
As a friend of Egypt it is my sincere hope that a solution will be found for the release of political prisoners as soon as possible.
Thus, Egypt will relieve this political burden and will be able to focus on its real and positive agenda.

"I can't think of a better way to spend Earth Day than in one of our greatest national treasures, the Everglades." —President Obama
"If we don't act, there may not be an Everglades as we know it." —President Obama #ActOnClimate
"The Pentagon says that climate change poses an increasing set of risks for global security." —President Obama #ActOnClimate
"Climate change can no longer be denied. It can't be edited out. It can't be omitted from the conversation." —President Obama #ActOnClimate
"Every dollar invested in the National Park Service generates $10 for the American economy. That's a good investment." —President Obama
"No matter who you are, no matter where you live, our parks ... are your birthright as Americans."  —President Obama  #FindYourPark
"This is not some impossible problem that we cannot solve. We can solve it if we have the political will." —President Obama #ActOnClimate
"We are blessed with the most beautiful God-given landscape in the entire world ... We have to be good stewards for it." —President Obama

Dramatic situation in the #Mediterranean is a European issue. I called today's #EUCO to mobilise all efforts to help solve it. #migrationEU
Saving innocent people's lives is 1st priority. This includes rescuing people, but also fighting smugglers & preventing illegal #migration.
Four actions: first, we need to break up networks, undermine business model of people smugglers. (1/4) #migrationEU #EUCO
We need to boost EU border operations #Triton and #Poseidon with more resources. (2/4) #migrationEU #EUCO
We need better cooperation with & support to countries of origin & transit in order to discourage people to put their lives at risk. (3/4)
We will discuss how to reinforce European solidarity; look into issues of resettlement, relocation, processing of asylum applications. (4/4)
We cannot solve the problem today. Europe is not the cause of the problem: its real causes are war, instability & poverty #migrationEU #EUCO
We must all make a greater effort to handle worst consequences and agree on concrete action, today. #migrationEU #EUCO
Arrival at the European Council #EUCO #Greece #migrationEU #Mediterranean http://t.co/cgvSg9MnvE

LIVE on @OFA #Periscope: President Obama is speaking at the 2015 Spring Summit. http://t.co/j3cxgyiH9q
"You guys sound fired up!" —President Obama at the @OFA Spring Summit
"I'm proud of all of you, and I hope all of you are proud of what we've done together." —President Obama to @OFA supporters
"Today, more than 16 million Americans have gained the security of health insurance." —President Obama
"This set of trade agreements that we're looking at is vital to middle-class economics." —President Obama #LeadOnTrade
"America needs to write the rules of the global economy. We can't leave it to somebody else." —President Obama #LeadOnTrade
"We want to make sure we win the future. That's what America is about." —President Obama
"It's the most progressive trade agreement in our history." —President Obama #LeadOnTrade
"It's not just good for our businesses, it's good for our workers." —President Obama #LeadOnTrade
"The status quo isn't working for our workers." —President Obama #LeadOnTrade
"My entire presidency has been about helping working families." —President Obama
"I've been fighting income inequality since before it was cool." —President Obama
"We've got to fight for trade that benefits our workers—on our terms." —President Obama #LeadOnTrade
"If I didn't think this was the best thing to do for working families, I would not be doing it." —President Obama #LeadOnTrade
"Talk to your friends, talk to your neighbors, talk about why this work matters." —President Obama to @OFA supporters
"You give me hope. You guys are doing extraordinary things." —President Obama to @OFA supporters
